org.dblp.mmdb

Interface RecordDbInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    RecordDbLocalInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RecordDb

    public interface RecordDbInterface
extends RecordDbLocalInterface
    The global interface for accessing dblp records from a dblp record DB structure.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.util.stream.Stream<PersonName> allHomonyms(PersonName name)
      Retrieves a sequential stream of all person objects that are homonyms of the given person name object, including that given person name object if it exists in dblp.
      java.util.stream.Stream<PersonName> allHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
      Retrieves a sequential stream of all person name objects that are homonyms of the given name string, including person name objects of that given name string if it exists in dblp.

      Retrieves a sequential stream of all booktitles in dblp.

      Trigger that the lazy coauthor graph data structure is build, if it has not been build yet.

      Trigger that the lazy homonymous name map is build, if it has not been build yet.

      Trigger that the lazy external ID map is build, if it has not been build yet.

      Retrieve an unmodifiable collection of all person name objects that are homonyms of the given name string, including person name objects of that given name string if it exists in dblp.

      • ensureHomonymMap

        Trigger that the lazy homonymous name map is build, if it has not been build yet.

      • ensureIdMap

        Trigger that the lazy external ID map is build, if it has not been build yet.

      • ensureCoauthorGraph

        void ensureCoauthorGraph()
        Trigger that the lazy coauthor graph data structure is build, if it has not been build yet.

        Waring: Forcing the coauthor graph to build completely is kind of inefficient and requires a lot of main memory.

                               java.lang.String id)

      • hasOtherHomonyms

        default boolean hasOtherHomonyms(Person pers)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Checks whether a given person has any homonyms in dblp other than that given person. Checking of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If the given person has more than one name in dblp, all alias names are checked for homonyms as well.

        Parameters:
        pers - The person to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the person has any homonyms, otherwise false .
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • hasOtherHomonyms

        default boolean hasOtherHomonyms(PersonName name)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Checks whether the given person name has homonyms in dblp other than that given person name object. Checking of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the person to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the specified name has any other homonyms, otherwise false .
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • hasOtherHomonymsByName

        default boolean hasOtherHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
                                throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Checks whether the given person name has any homonyms in dblp other than that given name string. Checking of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the person to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the specified name has any other homonyms, otherwise false .
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • getOtherHomonyms

        default java.util.Collection<PersonName> getOtherHomonyms(PersonName name)
                                                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieve an unmodifiable collection of all person objects that are homonyms of the given person name object, explicitly excluding that given person name object. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The homonymous name.
        Returns:
        The homonymous persons, or an empty set if the given name has no other homonyms.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • getOtherHomonymsByName

        default java.util.Collection<PersonName> getOtherHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
                                                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieve an unmodifiable collection of all person name objects that are homonyms of the given name string, explicitly excluding the person name object of that given name string if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The name string.
        Returns:
        The homonymous persons, or an empty set if the given name has no other homonyms.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • otherHomonyms

        default java.util.stream.Stream<PersonName> otherHomonyms(PersonName name)
                                                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieves a sequential stream of all person objects that are homonyms of the given person name object, explicitly excluding that given person name object if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The homonymous name.
        Returns:
        The stream of homonymous persons, or an empty stream if the given name has no other homonyms.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • otherHomonymsByName

        default java.util.stream.Stream<PersonName> otherHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
                                                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieves a sequential stream of all person name objects that are homonyms of the given name string, explicitly excluding the person name object of that given name string if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The name string.
        Returns:
        The stream of homonymous persons, or an empty stream if the given name has no other homonyms.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • numberOfOtherHomonyms

        default int numberOfOtherHomonyms(PersonName name)
                           throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieve the number of homonyms of the given name in dblp, explicitly excluding that given person name object if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The homonymous name.
        Returns:
        The number of homonyms, or 0 if the given name has no other homonyms.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • numberOfOtherHomonymsByName

        default int numberOfOtherHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieve the number of homonyms of the given name in dblp, explicitly excluding the person name object of that given name string if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The name string.
        Returns:
        The number of homonyms, or 0 if the given name has no other homonyms.

      • getAllHomonyms

        default java.util.Collection<PersonName> getAllHomonyms(PersonName name)
                                                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieve an unmodifiable collection of all person objects that are homonyms of the given person name object, including that given person name object if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The person name.
        Returns:
        The homonymous persons, or an empty set if the given name is not in dblp.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • getAllHomonymsByName

        java.util.Collection<PersonName> getAllHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
                                               throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieve an unmodifiable collection of all person name objects that are homonyms of the given name string, including person name objects of that given name string if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The name string.
        Returns:
        The homonymous persons, or an empty set if the given name is not in dblp.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • allHomonyms

        default java.util.stream.Stream<PersonName> allHomonyms(PersonName name)
                                                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieves a sequential stream of all person objects that are homonyms of the given person name object, including that given person name object if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The person name.
        Returns:
        The stream of homonymous persons, or an empty stream if the given name is not in dblp.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • allHomonymsByName

        java.util.stream.Stream<PersonName> allHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
                                               throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieves a sequential stream of all person name objects that are homonyms of the given name string, including person name objects of that given name string if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The name string.
        Returns:
        The stream of homonymous persons, or an empty stream if the given name is not in dblp.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • numberOfAllHomonyms

        default int numberOfAllHomonyms(PersonName name)
                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieve the number of homonyms of the given name in dblp, including that given person name object if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The person name.
        Returns:
        The number of homonyms, or 0 if the given name is not in dblp.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • numberOfAllHomonymsByName

        int numberOfAllHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieve the number of homonyms of the given name in dblp, including person name objects of that given name string if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Parameters:
        name - The name string.
        Returns:
        The number of homonyms, or 0 if the given name is not in dblp.

      • numberOfCoauthorCommunities

        int numberOfCoauthorCommunities(Person person,
                                boolean allowDisambiguations)
                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Return the number of coauthor communities of the given person.
        Parameters:
        person - The person.
        allowDisambiguations - If true, disambiguation profiles are valid coauthor nodes that link the network. Otherwise, disambiguation profiles are considered to have no coauthors and end up as singleton cluster nodes in the network.
        Returns:
        The number of communities.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified person is null.

      • getCoauthorCommunity

        java.util.Collection<Person> getCoauthorCommunity(Person person,
                                                  int index,
                                                  boolean allowDisambiguations)
                                           throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                  java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Retrieve a specific coauthor community of a given person.
        Parameters:
        person - The person.
        index - The community index, starting with 0.
        allowDisambiguations - If true, disambiguation profiles are valid coauthor nodes that link the network. Otherwise, disambiguation profiles are considered to have no coauthors and end up as singleton cluster nodes in the network.
        Returns:
        The coauthors of this community.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified person is null.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumberOfCommunities())

      • getCoauthorCommunityIndex

        default int getCoauthorCommunityIndex(Person person,
                                      Person coauthor,
                                      boolean allowDisambiguations)
                               throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Retrieve the community index of a coauthor of a given person.
        Parameters:
        person - The central person.
        coauthor - The coauthor to look up in the coauthor communities of person.
        allowDisambiguations - If true, disambiguation profiles are valid coauthor nodes that link the network. Otherwise, disambiguation profiles are considered to have no coauthors and end up as singleton cluster nodes in the network.
        Returns:
        The community index between 0 and getNumberOfCommunities()), or -1 if no such coauthor exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the specified persons is null.

      • getShortestCoauthorPath

        java.util.List<Person> getShortestCoauthorPath(Person first,
                                               Person second,
                                               boolean allowDisambiguations)
        Retrieves a list of person that form path of coauthors between the two given authors using a minimal number of edges. If no such path exists, an empty list is returned.

        Note: This is a very expensive operation, so handle with care!

        Parameters:
        first - The first person.
        second - The second person.
        allowDisambiguations - If true, disambiguation profiles are valid coauthor nodes that link the network. Otherwise, disambiguation profiles are considered to have no outgoing coauthors.
        Returns:
        The path as list of persons, or an empty list if no such path exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either of the given persons is null.

      • getShortestCoauthorPath

        default java.util.List<Person> getShortestCoauthorPath(Person first,
                                                       Person second)
        Retrieves a list of person that form path of coauthors between the two given authors using a minimal number of edges. If no such path exists, an empty list is returned. Disambiguation profiles are considered to be valid coauthor nodes that link the network.

        Note: This is a very expensive operation, so handle with care!

        Parameters:
        first - The first person.
        second - The second person.
        Returns:
        The path as list of persons, or an empty list if no such path exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either of the given persons is null.
